page.title: 19Children's Games
page.content: The children who live in Upper Clatford go to Goodworth Clatford School. They play in the Recreation Field by Pillhill Brook where there are swings and a slide. Another favourite haunt is Bury Hill, the old iron age fort. They play football, rounders, spies and plan attacks on each other up there - friendly of course! They tend to congregate on the green on the way up to Bury Hill. Bicycles are very popular as the village is very spread out and the children might live some distance from their friends. They also play around the river and on the old 'Sprat and Winkle' railway line. They go swimming at the sheep dip and fish in the river too.
